    Getting started

    Estimate lake water balance based on a minimal set of inputs

    calc_wbal.Rd

    Estimate lake water balance based on a minimal set of inputs

    Usage

    calc_wbal(
  aeme_time,
  model,
  use,
  hyps,
  inf,
  outf = NULL,
  level = NULL,
  obs_lake = NULL,
  obs_met,
  ext_elev,
  elevation,
  print_plots = FALSE,
  coeffs = NULL
)

    Arguments

    aeme_time

    list; time object from aeme_object using `time()`

    model

    vector; of models to be used. Can be `dy_cd`, `glm_aed`, `gotm_wet`.

    hyps

    data frame of hypsographic curve, elevation (masl) and planar area (m^2)

    inf

    list of inflow data frames

    outf

    list of outflow data frames. Default = NULL

    level

    data frame of lake water level observations.. cols = Date, value

    obs_lake

    data frame of lake observations in ensemble standard format

    obs_met

    data frame of meteorology, must include MET_tmpair, MET_wndspd & MET_prvapr, continuous Date, extent defines output extent

    ext_elev

    numeric; elevation to extend bathymetry

    elevation

    numeric; elevation of lake

    print_plots

    logical; print plots of water balance components

    coeffs

    numeric vector; coefficients for estimating lake surface temperature. Default = NULL

    method

    character; method for estimating lake water level. Options are "use_obs", "sinusoidal", "constant".

    Value

    data frame of water balance components which are: - Date - lvlwtr - HYD_flow -...

    On this page
